text: Bottle shared at Jasons. Purple in color with tart notes beery spritz and a bit of blue cheese.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours deep purple with a decent pink head. Aroma of berries and fruit. Taste is berries, citrus, oak, and funk. Very nice.

Bottle with thanks to Matt! Pours a deep purple, burgundy, with a fairly sizable pinkish purple white head that fizzes away pretty quickly. Really beautiful color on this one. Aroma is all berries, not really distinctive other than raspberries. What the Romanians would call Fructe de Padure. Some lactic acid and lemon on the nose as well. Flavor is less tart than many, loads of berry notes and lactic acidity. Light body, fizzy carbonation. Grate.

Bottle given to me by Justin, thanks man! Pour is a beautiful rich purple with a large fizzy pink head. Aroma is incredible. Lightly tart with musty berry and then jam, lots of it. Lightly sweet and tart jam. Awesome. Flavor is quite tart up front with light funky and berry to follow. Effervescent palate and a quick berry finish. Big flavor but clean. Flavor not as jammy as Aroma. Excellent.

bottle shared by a friend, poured a deep dark purple colour with a non to long lasting pink head. lots of carbonation. nose has a ton of dark forrest fruits, dark berries, berry marmalade, classic de garde funk, ton of sweet fruits, citrus, almost vinegar sour, carbonated, just enough sour (almost to much) tart, jam, acid berry. yes again a very nice de garde

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 Bottle at De Garde Quarterly. Pours a dark purple with medium frothy pink head that lasts. The aroma is strong berry and oak. Thick mouth, very jammy, nice tart berry, light acidity, really enjoyed this one.
Bottle. Pours deep purple with pink head. Nose is lots of berry. Tast is tart berries and lots of general tartness. Good.

(750ml bottle) the deepest red berry, lasting pink bubbles. Nose of huge berry, raspberry and other berries, de Garde sour and funk mix. Taste is amazingly full of fruit, raspberry, medium sourness, perfect palate linger.

750ml. Thanks Morgan for sharing. Thick dark red. Like the skin of a raspberry. Aroma is a berry kick in the face. Taste is raspberry and black berry. Ton of it, Like second only to R&D sour fruit in that category. Signature de garde sour with a touch of funk. This is really good. I love a super jammy spour, but this is almost too much fruit. Almost like Im wondering if this is preserves not beer. But the sour is there almost balancing it out. Really good stuff. Damn.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Ra-rate 1/28/17: Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Tons of juicy berries, funk, oak, sour. 8/4/8/4/16=4

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Beautiful purple. Jammy berries, lacto. Sour. 8/5/8/3/16=4
750ml bottle pours a brilliant purple color with lots of purple head. Lots of berry aroma. Sharp tartness and some berry flavor.
yum yum, bottle thanks to Cliff. This is your standard lightly vinegary berry (almost lambic berry) flavors. Impressive and tasty. One dimensional and no complexity.
Bottle - Intense Berry. Deep red purple with a pink head. Perfumy, rich Berry notes, and nice peel. Nice.

Bottle at De Garde, pours a deep dark purpleish mahogany with a small pink head. Aroma brings out loads of pithy berry notes, moderate tartness and earth. Flavour is very pithy, with loads of dark berries, dirty earthy notes and shit tons of pith, almost too much. It works alright, but its rather muddy. Okay.

Bouteille 75cl de et partagée avec Pierre T.
Couleur acajou-pourpre, col rosé disparaissant vite.
Arôme est intense, fruité de baies dont lélément principale est bien la framboise. Retrouve un rétro terreux, fruits fraichement récoltés avec une pointe de levure sauvage.
Palais est fruité versant de suite dans le profil de framboise, terreux dominant ponctué par une fine note aigrelette provenant certainement des mûres. Effervescence est moyenne-haute. Le côté aigre nest cependant pas trop avenant et laisse ample place aux fruits.
Bottle. Pours bright red with thick pink hea aroma is extreme berry, raspberry, vinegar, citrusy, oak, winey. Taste is sour throughout, crisp, med bod, high carbonation. Overall, very good.

Bottle thanks to Darrel. Pours out a dark cherry red almost purple topped with a pretty deep pink head. Nose is great heavy blackberry raspberry jam sweetness and tart. Great tart notes not over the top acidic blackberry raspberry goodness. Wow this is tasty.

Bottle. Deep garnet pour with a fleeting white head. Loads of berries in the nose. Typical De Garde base beer with nice berry overtones. For De Garde, its pretty much as good as it gets. Average body and mouthfeel.
Bottle - pours purple pink head - nose and taste of berry, lactic acid, funk, black and boysen sour berry - medium body

750 mL bottle. Deep purple with a pink head. Pretty. Smell is heavy on the raspberry and de Garde yeast. Taste isnt as dynamic. Mostly lemon sourness and that de Garde acidity. Berry fruit flavor in the back end. Oak. Light body. High carbonation. Too much. Not offensive. Just not exactly good.
